newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Skanska, Securum say to list Pandox.
newsitem.headline: Skanska, Securum say to list Pandox.

text.p: Swedish construction company Skanska said on Tuesday that it and state holding company Securum are to list hotel property group Pandox on the Stockholm bourse before the end of June.
When Pandox was formed in 1995 by merging Skanska and Securum's hotel properties, plans existed to list it in three to five years, the companies said in a joint statement.
At the time, Pandox encompassed 15 properties to a book value of 1.2 billion crowns.
Brokerage Alfred Berg will introduce the company on the bourse, Skanska and Securum said.

"A bourse introduction of Pandox is in line with Skanska's strategy to list part of our real estate holdings," Skanska's vice president Mats Mared said, adding that the company already had listed Norrporten and Piren.
"The timing for a bourse introduction seems suitable and is in line with Securum's divestment strategy," Securum's chief executive Jan Kvarnstrom said.
Securum was formed to take over assets pledged by Nordbanken during the Swedish bank crisis in the early 1990s and aims to divest all holdings at reasonable prices.
